alert.note: Alert for Dubuque (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 9:06PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Dubuque, Jackson and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Mercer, Louisa, Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Dubuque and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Muscatine, Rock Island, Louisa and Mercer Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Clinton, Rock Island, Scott and Whiteside Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Clinton, Carroll, Jackson and Jo Daviess Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Hancock, Lee, Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Muscatine, Rock Island and Scott Counties. Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Louisa and Mercer Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Clinton, Carroll and Whiteside Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Rock Island and Scott Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.8 feet, Lock and Dam 11 is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to 20.4 feet next Tuesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon.
